summary: Psychosis is a mental condition that makes it hard to tell the difference between reality and fantasy. People with psychosis might experience delusions, hallucinations, confused thoughts, and strange behavior. It can be caused by various factors, including mental illnesses like schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, or depression, as well as physical conditions, medications, or substance abuse. Treatment involves medication, therapy, and support, with early intervention being key to better outcomes. Approximately 3% of Americans will experience psychosis at some point in their lives.
title: Psychosis
